ygData.subject: Re: Why
ygData.msgSnippet: why ask why? or better yet, why pick any of the other classes? it all comes down on what you feel like being, what you want to accomplish, and who you want to
ygData.messageBody:
why ask why?

or better yet, why pick any of the other classes?
it all comes down on what you feel like being, what you want to accomplish,
and who you want to be.

although a weak pet, I like having a pet around to help out deal a little
damage, and even take hits when I am ready to retreat. Something that the
other fighters cannot do.

I cannot give you reasons on why to be a Knight of the Shadows. I like what
I do, I like who I am. When people ask what I am, I call out that I am a
Knight. we may be shadow knights, but we are knights nevertheless. Knights
with dark powers rearing over our heads. Although it may seem that we are
weak compared to many of the other classes, there has hardly been very high
level knights to truelly know if the class is weak or strong in the later
levels. This I want to see for myself.

My Knight of the Shadows is my first, and primary character since
commercial, and I am sticking with it til 50th at least. If the cap is not
off by then, then more than likely i'm gonna go try a Rogue, and I hope
their abilities are fully implemented by then.

I cannot give a reason why you should be a knight, I can only give you
reasons why I like being a knight...everyone has different tastes in style
and gore.

When it comes to race, I don't recommend the dark elf...surely dark elves
are "cool", but they have some of the weakest stats. If your gonna solo
alot, altho I dont recommend, be a Troll. on the other hand troll and
especially dark elven knights are almost quite common, you dont see many
ogre knights, nor, especially, human knights, which are quite rare indeed.

Sorry for my babblin...hope everyone picks the right course for their
knight, or if not, goodluck to you without your knighthood.

Kael Deathwind
Knight of the Shadows

----------

> To: eq_shadowknights@onelist.com
> Subject: [eq_shadowknights] Why

> Things have been quite lately, and I've been wondering something: why do
> people choose to play shadowknights? Has anybody had trouble
role-playing
> one? Playing Everquest, it takes so much time for a character to
develop,
> exspecially for SK's, what about the class makes it worth it?
>
> Sylkke
> Veeshan
